channel.title: D'Antona F. on Giacomo Cordoni
channel.description: Recent content in D'Antona F. on Giacomo Cordoni

item.title: Hubble Space Telescope survey of Magellanic Cloud star clusters. Photometry and astrometry of 113 clusters and early results
item.description: Homogeneous HST photometry and astrometry of 113 clusters revels unexpcted results in the context of young star clusters in the Magellanic Clouds

item.title: Mass loss along the red giant branch in 46 Globular Clusters and their multiple populations
item.description: A chromosome map to unveil stellar populations with different magnesium abundances. The case of Omega Centauri

item.title: The Hubble Space Telescope UV Legacy Survey of Galactic globular clusters - XXI. Binaries among multiple stellar populations
item.description: The Hubble Space Telescope UV Legacy Survey of Galactic globular clusters - XXI. Binaries among multiple stellar populations

item.title: Multiple populations in globular clusters and their parent galaxies
item.description: By exploiting recent work based on Gaia, half of the known Type II GCs appear clustered in a distinct region of the integral of motions space, thus suggesting a common progenitor galaxy. Except for these Type II GCs, we do not find any significant difference in the MPs between clusters associated with different progenitors.

item.title: Chemical Abundances along the 1G Sequence of the Chromosome Maps: The Globular Cluster NGC 3201
item.description: We suggest that a small variation in metals and binarity governs the color spread of the 1G in the ChM and that evolved BSs contribute to the bluest tail of the 1G sequence.

item.title: Is helium the key parameter in the extended colour spread of the first generation stars in M3?
item.description: Internal variation of helium content cannot reproduce all the observational constraints at the same time. The origin of the first generation colour spread is therefore still without a straightforward explanation.

item.title: The Hubble Space Telescope UV Legacy Survey of Galactic Globular Clusters. XIX. A Chemical Tagging of the Multiple Stellar Populations Over the Chromosome Maps
item.description: Chemical Tagging of the Multiple Stellar Populations Over the Chromosome Maps

item.title: Mass Loss of Different Stellar Populations in Globular Clusters: The Case of M4
item.description: New analysis of the HB branch reveals breaks the degeneracy on the horizontal branch. Second generation stars need to lose more mass than first generation stars

item.title: Extended main sequence turnoff as a common feature of galactic open clusters
item.description: Photometric analysis of the extended Main Sequence Turn-off in 12 Galcactic Open clusters.

item.title: The Hubble Space Telescope UV legacy survey of galactic globular clusters - XVI. The helium abundance of multiple populations
item.description: Helium variations in multiple stellar populations for 58 galactic globular clusters

item.title: Extended main sequence turnoff as a common feature of galactic open clusters
item.description: Photometric analysis of the extended Main Sequence Turn-off in 12 Galcactic Open clusters.
